definition: A strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.
A strong feeling of dislike or disapproval for something unpleasant or offensive.
An unpleasant emotion caused by the threat of danger, pain, or harm.
A feeling of great pleasure and happiness.
The condition or quality of being sad; sorrow; a feeling of unhappiness or grief.
A feeling of mild astonishment or shock caused by something unexpected.
Not displaying any strong emotion or feeling; a lack of emotional expression.
